snippet: In the wake of Hurricane Sandy,  health care workers and patients were confronted by a new kind of disarray.
abstract: “Consequences of bad decision, bad luck and equipment failures cascade through New York City region’s health care system in wake of Hurricane Sandy, as health care workers and patients are confronted by new kind of disarray, illustrated by evacuation of Bellevue Hospital Center;” hospital executives are reluctant to criticize their colleagues or city officials, but say sequence of events have left them with many questions.

byline.original: By ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS and NINA BERNSTEIN
